Cognitive dissonance (c) is the concept that best explains this thought process. The doctor is experiencing discomfort or dissonance because he knows that smoking is unhealthy but continues to do it. To reduce this dissonance, he justifies his behavior by telling himself that he can offset the negative effects of smoking by eating healthily. This is an example of cognitive dissonance reduction through rationalization.
